result.execSummary:
The defendant Abraham D Martinez-Montes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Abraham D Martinez-Montes is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Abraham D Martinez-Montes was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Paid by bond.  $200 DNA surcharge remitted.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Abraham D Martinez-Montes

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Roberto R. Ledesma.  Adrienne E. Blais appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Patricio Ortiz, interpreter, appeared.
